Name: Requiring the department of sanitation to report on the number and location of public litter baskets.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of sanitation to report on the number and location of public litter baskets
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: October 31, 2018 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - October 31, 2018

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Sanitation to submit a quarterly report to the City Council and each Community Board documenting the number of public litter baskets in each council and community district, and each litter basket’s location.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 16 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 16-143 to read as follows:
      � 16-143 Litter basket report. The department shall provide the council and each community board with a report on public litter baskets within 30 days of the beginning of each quarter. Such report shall identify, by council district and community district, the number of litter baskets maintained by the department for the public disposal of litter that were in use at the end of the previous quarter, as well as each such litter basket's location. All data shall be reported in a machine-readable format.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 60 days after it becomes law.
      






JEF
LS #8035
9/26/2018
